alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 09 at 12:29PM MST until January 09 at 1:00PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 100 PM MST FOR SOUTHERN JEFFERSON COUNTY... At 1227 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 15 miles south of Boulder to 8 miles southwest of Whitehall, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Difficult and potentially dangerous travel. Locations impacted include... Homestake Pass, Whitehall, Cardwell, and Elk Park. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
